@description.body:

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Commands can be used to globally define keyboard shortcuts. They could also be used to assign an execution of a command sequence to multiple widgets. It is possible to use the same Command in a MenuButton and ToolBarButton for example. NOTE: Instances of this class must be disposed of after use

@param.name: @param
@param.body: shortcut {String} Shortcuts can be composed of optional modifier keys Control, Alt, Shift, Meta and a non modifier key. If no non modifier key is specified, the second parameter is evaluated. The key must be separated by a + or - character. Examples: Alt+F1, Control+C, Control+Alt+Delete
@param.description: Shortcuts can be composed of optional modifier keys Control, Alt, Shift, Meta and a non modifier key. If no non modifier key is specified, the second parameter is evaluated. The key must be separated by a + or - character. Examples: Alt+F1, Control+C, Control+Alt+Delete

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired when the command is executed. Sets the "data" property of the event to the object that issued the command.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether the command should be activated. If 'false' execute event wouldn't fire. This property will be used by command groups when activating/deactivating all commands of the group.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether the command should be respected/enabled. If 'false' execute event wouldn't fire. If value of property {@link qx.ui.command.Command#active} is 'false', enabled value can be set but has no effect until {@link qx.ui.command.Command#active} will be set to 'true'.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The command shortcut as a string

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The label, which will be set in all connected widgets (if available)

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The icon, which will be set in all connected widgets (if available)

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The tooltip text, which will be set in all connected widgets (if available)

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The value of the connected widgets

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The menu, which will be set in all connected widgets (if available)

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The owning object

@description.name: @description
@description.body: {String} The ID of the object.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: property apply

@description.name: @description
@description.body: property apply

@description.name: @description
@description.body: property apply

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fire the "execute" event on this command. If property active and enabled set to true.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: target {Object?} Object which issued the execute event
@param.description: Object which issued the execute event

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property qxOwner. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property qxOwner. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resets the user value of the property qxOwner. The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depending on the property configuration and value availability. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.
